title: Intro layout spacing, unified Continue/Submit pill buttons, and Zelda-like top-down movement/camera feel

requirements.summary: Add a consistent additional 25vh top offset to the IntroFlow layout across all stages without introducing layout shifting.
acceptanceCriteria: All intro stages rendered by `frontend/src/features/intro/IntroFlow.tsx` have an additional 25vh spacing from the top in addition to the existing top padding.
The top offset is applied consistently across stages including the slider question stage (`GoalStickinessQuestion`).
No stage introduces extra vertical jumping/shifting compared to the current stable layout behavior.

file_operations.description: Adjust the top spacing on the IntroFlow outer layout container so it includes the existing fixed top padding plus an additional 25vh (e.g., via a single combined padding-top calculation) to keep all stages top-aligned and stable across transitions.

requirements.summary: Unify styling for all IntroFlow "Continue" buttons and the slider question "Submit" button into a transparent pill with border matching the current text color.
acceptanceCriteria: All "Continue" buttons in `frontend/src/features/intro/IntroFlow.tsx` use the unified pill style (rounded 100px, transparent background, 1px solid border using current text color).
"Submit" in `frontend/src/features/intro/GoalStickinessQuestion.tsx` uses the same unified pill style.
Other CTAs (e.g., the start CTA in the opening lines) are not changed by this requirement.

file_operations.description: Update every "Continue" Button instance to use a shared pill-style class set (rounded-[100px], bg-transparent, border, border-current) while preserving each stageâ€™s intended text color; keep the Start/Start-now CTA unchanged. Use the shadcn-ui Button component to apply the unified style. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update the "Submit" Button (pre-submit state) and the post-feedback "Continue" Button to use the same unified pill style (rounded-[100px], bg-transparent, border, border-current with border color matching current text color). Use the shadcn-ui Button component to apply the unified style. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Refine the 2D game to feel like classic Zelda top-down movement with smooth continuous input and a camera-like top-to-bottom world progression, without adding collisions or combat.
acceptanceCriteria: Character movement is continuous while an arrow key is held (not dependent on OS key-repeat), and movement updates smoothly during gameplay.
Map scrolling/progression remains top-to-bottom and feels camera-like (i.e., the scene progression feels like a moving world rather than a static screen with occasional jumps).
The terrain remains brown and Zelda-inspired; no enemy/combat systems are introduced.
No collision/obstacle physics or blocking behavior is introduced (visual terrain details are allowed but must not block movement).

file_operations.description: Refactor the game loop to be deltaTime-based (time-scaled) rather than 'pixels per frame', and support a per-frame callback so movement and camera/world progression can update smoothly on requestAnimationFrame.

Move character movement updates into a per-frame loop (instead of only reacting to movement-state changes) and implement a Zelda-like top-down feel: smooth continuous movement while keys are held, plus a camera-like top-to-bottom progression using a world position + camera offset (optionally with smoothing/lerp) so the terrain scroll feels like a moving world. Keep the brown, Zelda-inspired terrain styling and ensure any terrain details remain purely visual (no blocking/collision logic).
